did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine Communications Department records, ca. 1970-2011

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine Communications Department

did.physdesc: Videocassettes, audio cassettes, press releases, tear sheets, publications, photographs, and ephemera.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Audiovisual materials produced and collected by the Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine Department of Communications, primarily related to .

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Communications Department of the Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine is responsible for publicity and external relations for the college.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Videocassettes, audio cassettes, press releases, tear sheets, publications, slides, photographs, and ephemera from the Communications Department of the Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine, dating from ca. 1970-2002.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University--College of Veterinary Medicine--Department of Communications

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Many of the video cassettes are in formats that require equipment unavailable at the Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections. Special arrangements are necessary to view these materials.

descgrp.p: See also the Veterinary College of Medicine Biomedical Communications Dept. records, #24-14-3352 and the Veterinary College of Medicine Subject Files and Photographs, #24-4-3385.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Cornell University College of Veterinary Medicine Department of Communications records #24-10-3338. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Audio and Video Cassettes
Boxes: 1, 7 -11

Several audio and video cassettes of varying formats. Most of the video cassettes are copies of stories run on television news or science programs featuring Cornell veterinarians. Some include local news coverage of college events. The audio tapes include recordings of college events as well as a number of American Association for the Advancement of Science program tapes. There are also 8 video tapes of interviews with several former deans of the college and then-president Hunter Rawlings which were recorded in 2000 for a promotional "Millennium" video that was never completed.

Series II. Publicity Subject Files
Boxes: 2 and 6
Press releases, tear sheets (news clippings), and miscellaneous publications containing references to college people, events and issues.

Series III. Photographs by Subject
Boxes: 2 - 4 and 9
Photographs, mostly from University Photography, arranged by subject; contains some slides.

Series IV. Photographs by Department
Boxes: 5 and 6
Negatives, contact sheets and some photos. Mostly portraits of faculty and staff arranged by department.
2 medallions created for the college centennial in 1994.
